column4: Okay, I have the stupidest question ever, and I bet the answer is totally obvious.
Where on my system is the user-dirs.dirs file?
And yes I have tried google too
Where on my system is the user-dirs.dirs file?
open file manager, go to your home folder, press ctrl-H to show hidden files, double click .config, voila.
Nope. 1) Unity is just a shell on top of GNOME. GNOME is still there. 2) There's an option on the login screen to use gnome-panel instead.
No idea, but #debian is offtopic for #ubuntu ;)
Fedora should write its own copy of GRUB during installation, so I'd expect that not to be a problem...
I'd tell you to check that with #fedora, but it sounds like you did and that wasn't helpful :\
They basically just laughed, without actually laughing -- so to speak
From the look of it, you got caught in crossfire between channel residents and someone asking for help with a version of Fedora from five years ago.
Seems like it. Some rude person insisted I was not asking about "current" Fedora version.
